intro: Palicourea anianguana, commonly known as the Brazilian moonseed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical leaves. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
